intro: Hagaea alsinifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf hagaea, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Hagaea alsinifolia is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Its aromatic foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
